title: The Beggar Boy
credit_line: Gift of Sarah Mellon Scaife and Richard King Mellon in memory of their mother, Jennie King Mellon
provenance_text:
Private Collection, Seville, Spain, before 1905; Sully & Co., London, England, until 1905; purchased by David Thompson Watson (1844-1916), Pittsburgh, PA, 1905 until February 24, 1916; D. T. Watson estate, February 1916 until April 17, 1917; D. T. Watson sale, American Art Association, Plaza Hotel, New York, NY, April 16-17, 1917, no. 154 [1]; Richard Beatty Mellon [1858-1933], Pittsburgh, PA, April 1917 until December 1, 1933; his wife, Jeannie King Mellon (d. November 1938); by descent to their daughter, Sarah Mellon Scaife [1903-1965], Pittsburgh, PA and their son, Richard King Mellon [1899-1970], Pittsburgh, PA [2]; their gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1940.

Notes: 
[1]. " Highly Important Old and Modern Paintings of Sterling Artistic Distinction". This painting, titled "Boy with Fruit and Bread" and illustrated in the catalogue, sold on April 17, 1917 for $6000 to W. W. Seaman, agent, apparently, for R. B. Mellon. See American Art News, April 21, 1917, p. 9.
[2]. Mrs. Scaife and Mr. Mellon donated this and two other paintings in memory of their mother.
